Art. 4.18. 
Usufruct of donated property
On the death of the donor, the surviving spouse who comes into the succession receives the usufruct of the property that the donor has donated and on which he has reserved the usufruct, provided that the spouse already had this status at the time of the donation and that the donor remained the holder of this usufruct until the day of his death.
On the donor's death, the surviving spouse who comes into the succession receives the usufruct of the property used as the family's main home on the date the succession is opened, and of the furniture that furnishes it, provided that the donor gave this property with usufruct reserved, that the spouse was legally cohabiting with the donor at the time of the gift and that the donor remained the owner of this usufruct until the day of his death.
The spouse may renounce this usufruct. Articles 4.244 to 4.253 apply to this renunciation when it takes place during the donor's lifetime.
